title: Landscape layout cuts off numpad/buttons when scientific mode is activated by default
body:
**Describe the bug**
When the "scientific mode" option in settings is enabled, and the app is used in landscape orientation, the numpad and buttons are cut off rather than scaling size as expected.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open settings
2. Enable "scientific mode" option
3. Return to calculator
4. Rotate device to landscape

**Expected behavior**
Buttons should scale to accommodate the new screen orientation and not be cut off.

**Screenshots/videos**


Expected layout (setting disabled):

![Screenshot_20250121-162132.png](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ceec9242-f188-4aec-a57a-7e76e37c52fa)



Actual layout (setting enabled):

![Screenshot_20250121-162159.png](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1f5ad4cc-69cc-4df3-bf61-c267de960862)


**Smartphone (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: Pixel 8 Pro
 - OS: Android 15 (AP4A.241205.013)
 - App version: 3.1.3, 3.1.0-beta1
 - Language: English

**Additional context**
App data and cache were both cleared prior to testing, no other settings were modified.
comments: I'm wondering if landscape should ignore the toggle as it shows the functions by default.
